get.summary: Retrieve many calculated metrics
get.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *favorite*: True if calculated metric has been marked as a 'Favorite'
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric
* *approved*: True if calculated metric has been marked as 'Approved'
* *shares*: Gives all existing shares for the calculated metric
* *sharesFullName*: Give 'shares', but also include the shared-to user's friendly login name as 'shareToDisplayName' in each share object
* *ownerFullName*: Add friendly full login name (string) to the 'owner' object

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.

parameters.name: includeType
parameters.description: Include additional calculated metrics not owned by user. The "all" option takes precedence over "shared"

parameters.name: rsids
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics tied to specified RSID list (comma-delimited)

parameters.name: dataType
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics compatible with the specified product

parameters.name: ownerId
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics owned by the specified loginId

parameters.name: calculatedMetricFilter
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs)

parameters.name: filterByIds
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs) (this is the same as calculatedMetricFilter, and is overwritten by calculatedMetricFilter

parameters.name: toBeUsedInRsid
parameters.description: The report suite where the calculated metric intended to be used.  This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.  If it is not specified then the permissions will be calculated based on the union of all metrics authorized in all groups the user belongs to.  If the compatibility expansion is specified and toBeUsedInRsid is not then the compatibility returned is based off the compatibility from the last time the calculated metric was saved.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics that contains the Name

parameters.name: dataGroup
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics with the given dataGroup

parameters.name: tagNames
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics that contains one of the tags

parameters.name: favorite
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics that are favorites

parameters.name: approved
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics that are approved

parameters.name: pagination
parameters.description: return paginated results

parameters.name: filterByModifiedAfter
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics modified since this date (ISO8601 format)

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: DEPRECATED use deleted includeType - include disabled calculated metrics in results

parameters.name: curatedRsid
parameters.description: Add curatedItem and alternateVariableNames based on the Rsid

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (base 0 - first page is "0")

400.description: Unable to retrieve list of calculated metrics shared with user

500.description: External API error; Calculated metric retrieval failed

401.description: Owner filter error; user specified is not in the same company as the requesting user

403.description: Requesting non-shared calculated metrics for other users is restricted to admin users

post.summary: Create a new Calculated Metric
post.description:
Creates a new calculated metric. The following attributes are available when creating a calculated metric:

IMPORTANT: Required Fields: name, definition, rsid

Optional fields: description

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):

```json

{"definition":{},"version":[1,0,0]}
```

A calculated metric response will always include these default items:* id, name, description, rsid, owner* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field as defined/documented in the GET endpoints (see GET "/calculatedmetrics" or GET "/calculatedmetrics/{id}" for more documentation).

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON-formatted Object containing key/value pairs for calculated metric creation.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

400.description: Invalid input; name, rsid, and definition are all required. Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object.

500.description: External API error; Calculated metric create or retrieval failed

put.summary: Update an existing calculated metric
put.description:
The following fields can be modified through this endpoint:
name, description, definition, owner, rsidExample "defintion" for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{},"version":[1,0,0]}

Response will be the newly modified calculated metric object after the update request completes.

CalculatedMetricResponse
A calculated metric response will always include these default items:* id, name, description, rsid, owner* Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field as defined/documented in the GET endpoints (see GET "/calculatedmetrics" or GET "/calculatedmetrics/{id}" for more documentation).

get.summary: Gets an array of datafeedRequest objects.
get.description: Gets an array of DataFeedRequest objects for a given report suite. If no time rnage is provided then it will default to all requests within the last week. If no requests are found in the given time range then this method will return an empty array. Time endDate and startDate are formatted as follows: http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14

parameters.name: rsid
parameters.description: The report suite ID for which to get the requests

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: The data feed for which to get the requests

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start of a date range to search for requests. Will default to 1 week if not provided.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end of a date range to search for requests. Will default to 1 week if not provided.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

put.summary: Updates the state of a feed.
put.description: Allows you to set the status of a feed to ACTIVE, HOLD or CANCELLED. Note, when changing from active to HOLD/CANCELLED and back to active, all requests between when the feed was cancelled/held to now will be generated. For example, if you set a daily feed to hold on March 12, then change it to active on March 22, 10 requests will be generated to catch the feed up. If more than a few requests will be generated then consider canceling the feed and creating a new one with the desired start date.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: The datafeed id to reprocess.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Feed state can be set to ACTIVE,HOLD or CANCELLED

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

post.summary: Returns a segment summary report for the segment definition in the post body
post.description:
Requires rsid and definition. Used to validate a segment definition and return basic reporting metrics for that definition. 


The response contains products that the definition is compatible with, as well as a series of totals that represent how many Page Views, Visits, and Visitors the segment includes.

Format for the order of Totals in response:


1) Number of Page Views that the segment includes for the given time period

2) Number of Visits that the segment includes for the given time period

3) Number of Unique Visitors that the segment includes for the given time period

4) Total number of Page Views for the time period (non-segmented)

5) Total number of Visits for the time period (non-segmented)

6) Total number of Unique Visitors for the time period (non-segmented)


The overall totals (3-6) can be used with the segment totals (1-3) to determine the percentage of the segment's audience for each metric.

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):


```

{
	"func": "segment",
	"container": {
		"func": "container",
		"context": "hits",
		"pred": {
			"func": "exists",
			"description": "Page",
			"val": {
				"func": "attr",
				"name": "variables/page"
			}
		}
	},
	"version": [1, 0, 0]
}


```

get.summary: Returns a top items report for the given dimension
get.description:
Get the top X items (based on paging restriction) for the specified dimension and rsid. Defaults to last 90 days.

Search Clause examples:
contains test: 'test'

 contains test or test1: 'test' OR 'test1'

contains test and test1: 'test' AND 'test1'

contains test and not (test1 or test2): 'test' AND NOT ('test1' OR 'test2')

does not contain test: NOT 'test'

get.summary: Retrieves all segments, or paginated segments
get.description:
A segment response will always include these default items:
id,name,description,rsid,owner

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
reportSuiteName: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
legacyId: Legacy segment ID from old segment database (only exists if the segment was migrated from the old segment DB)

asiInUse: True if the segment is currently in use in an ASI slot

shares: Gives all existing shares for the segment
sharesFullName: Give 'shares', but also include the shared-to user's friendly login name as 'shareToDisplayName' in each share object
ownerFullName: Add friendly full login name (string) to the 'owner' object
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

post.summary: Creates a new segment
post.description:
Creates a new segment. The following attributes are available when creating a segment:
Required: name, definition, rsid
Optional: description, aamStatus

Note: "aamStatus" is used to "publish" a report suite segment to other products in the Marketing Cloud. Description is always required when publishing with aamStatus. The report suite must already be pre-configured for AAM for publishing to succeed (see the "/segments/aamStatus/" endpoint for more information).
Format for aamStatus object:
"aamStatus":{"published":["rsid1","rsid2"]}

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

SegmentResponse
A segment response will always include these default items:
id, name, description, rsid, owner
Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field as defined/documented in the GET endpoints (see GET "/segments" or GET "/segments/{id}" for more documentation).

post.summary: Share 1 component with 1 user
post.description:
Note that only the following component types are currently supported: "segment", "project"
There are three valid values for "shareToType":
"all": Shares the component to all users in the organization. For this operation, "shareToId" is not required (ignored if sent)
"user": Shares the component with a specific user. For this operation, "shareToId" (the loginId of the user to share to) is required.
"group": Shares the component with an entire custom user group as defined in the Admin Console. For this operation, "shareToId" (the groupId of the group to share to) is required.

feedState.description: The State of the data feed.

feedType.description: The type of data feed. This cant be set. It should always be STANDARD. Older feeds might have the type set to INSIGHT which is legacy.

feedName.description: The name of the data feed. This needs to be unique since it is often used as a key.

startDate.description: The date that the data feed starts.

endDate.description: The date that the feed ends. Cannot be null. There must be a determined date for the feed to terminate.

deliveryPreset.description: An ID that points to a delivery preset that you want to use. The presets are S3, FTP, or SFTP.

deliveryFolder.description: The delivery preset has a host name. The delivery folder is the location on that host. The folder must be unique so that it doesnt overwrite data on the hosts file directory.

columnPreset.description: An ID pointing to a column preset. The column preset is a list of selected columns to be exported.

interval.description: How frequently the data is pulled.

packaging.description: When CHUNKED is selected the feed generates multiple files that are generated with the 'chunk size'. The packaging can also be FLAT. This will create one single file.

chunkSize.description: The chunk size is in MB. It ranges from 1 to 4 GB. If a value greater than 4GB is selected then it will default to 4GB. If a value smaller than 1GB is selected then it will default to 1GB.

manifest.description: There are 3 options for the manifest: NULL,FIN,CHUNKED. NULL == no manifest will be created. FIN == a finish file will be created upon completion indicating that the data feed upload has finished. This is useful because some customers have an FTP server that we will deliver their data to. When they have the fin file then they know that the data feed is complete. If you set packaging to CHUNKED then you also need the manifest to be set to CHUNKED as well. Then the manifest file will contain a list of all the chunked files.

notificationEmail.description: An array of emails that will receive notifications about this data feed.

delay.description: The delay in minutes to processing the job. If a feed is scheduled to run hourly, and the delay is set to 30, then the job wont be submitted until 30 minutes after the hour. Default is 0 minutes. This is useful if a customer knows that they will be submitting late data. If the delay is 0 then the most recent data will be downloaded immediately. However, many apps have data coming in late (for example offline mobile apps that later reconnect).

dynamicLookups.description: If this is set to true then the customers column set cannot include the user_agent column and must include the mobile_id column. When this is true and the other two conditions are met we will include mobile attributes in the feed. When its false the feed wont include mobile attributes in the feed.

replaceEscapedChars.description:
Some customers send in data with new lines and spaces. If they send data with a new line and 'escaped chars' is set to true then it will replace all new lines with a space instead. Here are the characters currently replaced when this field is set to true:   carriage return, 
 - newline, 	 - tab, \ - slash,   - space

createdBy.description: The creator of the data feed.

modifiedBy.description: The last user to modify the data feed.

rsid.description: The report suite to which this data feed belongs.

customerVisible.description: Flag for whether the data feed should be visible to the customer or not.

reportSuiteName.description: The friendly name for the report suite id.

owner.description: The owner of the segment as an Owner object.

isDeleted.description: Whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (deleted segments are only returned if requested by id)

migratedIds.description: A list of ids that have been migrated from one data center to another. This is the id of the segment in the old data center.  This is an array and can have multiple ids if the segment has been migrated more than once.

internal.description: Whether or not the segment is internal. Internal means that the segment is used by the product but not exposed to the customers

dwInUse.description: Whether or not the segment currently in use in a Data Warehouse request. A Data Warehouse request is another type of report that clients can run based on their raw data

asiInUse.description: Whether or not the segment currently in use in an ASI (old version of VSR) slot.

aamStatus.description: AAM/Raven publishing status (cross-product segment sharing). A segment can be published to AAM, and this flag indicates whether the segment has been published to AAM.

definition.description: The segment definition as a JSON object

compatibility.description: Analytics products that the segment is compatible with

legacyId.description: Legacy segment id from old segment database (only exists if the segment was migrated from the old segment DB)

template.description: Whether or not the segment is a template.  A template is a predefined segment that can be used by all customers and can not be edited

dataGroup.description: The data group of the segment

virtualReportSuites.description: A list of all Virtual Report Suites that are using this segment.

usageSummary.description: How frequently the user uses this segment.

siteTitle.description: A name for the report suite.  This is deprecated and should use the report suite name instead.

approved.description: Whether or not the segment has been marked approved.

favorite.description: Whether or not the segment has been marked as a favorite.

tags.description: All existing tags associated with the segment.

requestId.description: The ID of the data feed request.

feedId.description: The ID of the data feed.

feedName.description: The name of the data feed.

submittedDate.description: The date the data feed request was submitted.

backfillFlag.description: Flag indicating whether or not the request will be run on the backfill servers. 1=true, 0=false

firstRunDate.description: The date the data feed was first run.

firstCompleteDate.description: The date the data feed request was first completed.

runCount.description: The number of times the data feed request was run.

runAttempt.description: Run attempt is the date that the run was attempted.

completeDate.description: The date the data feed request was completed.

requestPeriodBegin.description: The date the data feed started making requests.

requestPeriodEnd.description: The date the data feed stopped making requests.

rsid.description: The report suite ID of the data feed.
The report suite id for which the component was created/updated

reportSuiteName.description: The report suite name for which the component was created/updated

id.description: This value will be auto generated by the system on creation. This value will be a id in the form of an ObjectId.

imsOrgId.description: This value will be looked up based on the analytics company of the user.

name.description: A human readable display name for users to be able to easily identify this classification definition.

description.description: A long description for the purpose of this classification set.

defaultListDelimiter.description: Default delimiter for list column types. Defaults to "," (comma). If you have no list columns this field does not apply.

defaultEncoding.description: Default encoding for jobs. Defaults to UTF-8.

columns.description: A list of classification column definitions. Column definitions are not required at the time of creation but no data will be classified until at least one column definition exists.

subscriptions.description: A list of classification subscriptions. Subscriptions are not required at the time of creation but no data will be classified until at least one subscription exists.

owner.description: Contact information for a person responsible for the classification definition and/or data.

lastModifiedBy.description: Email address of the last person that modified the classification set.

lastModifiedDate.description: Last modified date/time of the classification set.

notifications.description: List of notifications to be sent for all imports and exports that occur.

ftpSettings.description: Ftp settings for the classification set.

editable.description: Flag to indicate if the classification set is editable by the current user based on report suite permissions.

components.description: the list of components that have been tagged with this tag

rsid.description: The report suite id for which the component was created/updated

reportSuiteName.description: The report suite name for which the component was created/updated

polarity.description: Set metric polarity, which indicates whether it's good or bad if a given metric goes up. Default=positive

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in calculated metric result

rsid.description: The report suite id for which the component was created/updated

reportSuiteName.description: The report suite name for which the component was created/updated
